programme.title: ATP Final: Vienna
programme.desc: In a rematch of the Australian Open final, Jannik Sinner and Alexander Zverev meet in Vienna. Sinner, appearing in his eighth final of 2025, bids to deny Zverev a second title here. (26.10)

programme.title: ATP Final: Basel
programme.desc: Joao Fonseca vies for his maiden ATP 500 title as the 19-year-old Brazilian goes up against the number eight seed Alejandro Davidovich Fokina of Spain at the Swiss Indoors Basel. (26.10)

programme.title: ATP Final: Almaty
programme.desc: Daniil Medvedev competes in the Almaty title match, his 40th tour-level final, as the former world number one meets Corentin Moutet in what will be the his third ATP Tour final. (19.10)

programme.title: ATP Final: Rome
programme.desc: World number one Jannik Sinner takes on soon-to-be world number two Carlos Alcaraz in a blockbuster Italian Open final. Between them, the pair have won the last five majors. (18.05)

programme.title: WTA Final: Rome
programme.desc: A women's singles champion is crowned at the Italian Open, as home favourite and world number five Jasmine Paolini faces the American Coco Gauff. (17.05)

programme.title: Bitesize Tennis Classics
programme.desc: Bitesize highlights of men's British number one Jack Draper's first ATP 500 final, as the US Open semi-finalist fought Karen Khachanov for the Erste Bank Open trophy in Vienna. (27.10)

programme.title: ATP Final: Doha
programme.desc: In Doha, Great Britain's Jack Draper - entering his fifth ATP final - comes up against fifth seed and 2020 tournament champion Andrey Rublev in the final of the 2025 Qatar Open. (22.02)

programme.title: Live: WTA Jiujiang
programme.desc: On opening day of the Jiangxi Open, two of the top five seeds feature as Polina Kudermetova and Yulia Putintseva take on Tamara Korpatsch and Victoria Jimenez Kasintseva respectively.

programme.title: Live: WTA Tennis
programme.desc: The WTA 250 action continues as Ella Seidel gets underway in Jiangxi against Tiantsoa Rakotomanga Rajaonah, while Ajla Tomljanovic faces Momoko Kobori in her Hong Kong opener.

programme.title: Live: ATP Paris
programme.desc: Cam Norrie launches his Paris Masters campaign, facing Sebastian Baez, as fellow Brit Jacob Fearnley opens against 12th seed Andrey Rublev. Britain's Fran Jones features in WTA 250 action.

programme.title: WTA Final: Tokyo
programme.desc: Belinda Bencic enters a Tokyo final 10 years on from her last as the former Olympic champion meets a well-rested Linda Noskova, whose semi-final opponent Elena Rybakina withdrew. (26.10)

programme.title: WTA Final: Guangzhou
programme.desc: At the Guangzhou Open, New Zealander Lulu Sun competes in her second career WTA final against the American second seed Ann Li, who appears in her sixth at this level. (26.10)

programme.title: ATP Final: Toronto
programme.desc: Ben Shelton features in his first ATP Masters final as the 22-year-old eyes world number six status against Karen Khachanov, who ends a seven-year wait to compete on this stage. (07.08)

programme.title: WTA Final: Montreal
programme.desc: Rising Canadian star Victoria Mboko's miracle Montreal run continues as the 18-year-old meets four-time Grand Slam champion Naomi Osaka in her first tour-level final. (07.08)

programme.title: ATP Final: Geneva
programme.desc: In what was a chance for Novak Djokovic to join Jimmy Connors and Roger Federer in winning a 100th tour-level title, the 38-year-old Serb battled Hubert Hurkacz in the Geneva Open final.

programme.title: WTA Final: Cincinnati
programme.desc: Six-time Grand Slam champion Iga Swiatek faces Jasmine Paolini for the Cincinnati title. In what will be Swiatek's 13th WTA 1000 final, Paolini is competing in just her third. (18.08)

programme.title: Ticket to Paradise
programme.desc: (2022) Romcom with Julia Roberts and George Clooney. A staggeringly beautiful, divorced couple reunite to stop their daughter's wedding in the staggeringly beautiful surroundings of Bali.

programme.title: Venom: Let There Be Carnage
programme.desc: (2021) Tom Hardy returns as Marvel's gnarly antihero, to face a symbiote spawned from Venom's own blood living inside a serial killer who looks just like Woody Harrelson. Yikes.

programme.title: The House of Mirth
programme.desc: (1999) Gillian Anderson stars as Lily Bart, a spirited member of turn-of-the-century New York society, who gambles with her happiness in Terence Davies's sumptuous, romantic film.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: LumoTV: Deaf Funny
programme.desc: Comedy sketch show in BSL with a variety of characters, including a fitness fanatic, a police officer and a football manager.

programme.title: Yesterday's Enemy
programme.desc: (1959) Wartime drama with Stanley Baker. The captain of a British army patrol deciphers secret enemy battle plans, but does so at a great moral cost.

programme.title: Last Night in Soho Interview...
programme.desc: ...Special: Director Edgar Wright and co-writer Krysty Wilson-Cairns discuss travelling through time and recreating the past to make the ingenious and atmospheric psychological thriller.

programme.title: Hell Is a City
programme.desc: (1960) Classic crime thriller with Stanley Baker and Billie Whitelaw. A world-weary detective with a messy private life tracks a violent thief through the streets of Manchester.

programme.title: The Man Between
programme.desc: (1953) Atmospheric thriller set in post-war Berlin, where Ivo Kern (James Mason) and Susanne Mallison (Claire Bloom) get caught up in a maelstrom of bigamy, blackmail and bullets.

programme.title: Siege at Red River
programme.desc: (1954) Western. Van Johnson stars as a Confederate agent who steals a Gatling gun prototype from the Yankees and attempts to smuggle it south through enemy lines to his own side.

programme.title: G.I. Joe: The Rise of Cobra
programme.desc: (2009) Action adventure with Channing Tatum, Sienna Miller and Christopher Eccleston. Terrorists steal a devastating weapon and only the USA's finest - the GI Joes - can stop them.

programme.title: M3GAN
programme.desc: (2022) Creepy-doll horror with Allison Williams. A robotics engineer simultaneously invents an AI dolly and takes on the care of her orphaned niece. But can a cyborg really raise a kid?

programme.title: Bullet Train
programme.desc: (2022) Leaving from Platform 4 - a high octane, Shinkansen-set comedy thriller with Brad Pitt, Joey King and Michael Shannon. A jaded assassin does one last job on a villain-packed train.

programme.title: Barbarian
programme.desc: (2022) Don't-go-down-in-the-cellar horror with Georgina Campbell. A double-booked Airbnb leads a woman into some very dark places beneath the house she's staying in. With Bill SkarsgÃ¥rd.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Robin and Marian
programme.desc: (1976) Touching romance starring Sean Connery and Audrey Hepburn. The ageing legend Robin Hood returns to Sherwood Forest and discovers that, while he was away, Marian has become an Abbess.

programme.title: The Sound Barrier
programme.desc: (1952) Drama starring Ralph Richardson as a pioneering aviator determined to break the sound barrier, even if it means risking the lives of those closest to him. Directed by David Lean.

programme.title: Carrington, VC
programme.desc: (1954) Anthony Asquith's vivid and subtle courtroom drama casts David Niven as the eponymous officer accused of stealing army money and going absent without leave.

programme.title: Last Night in Soho Interview...
programme.desc: ...Special: Director Edgar Wright and co-writer Krysty Wilson-Cairns discuss travelling through time and recreating the past to make the ingenious and atmospheric psychological thriller.

programme.title: Transformers: Revenge of the...
programme.desc: ...Fallen: (2009) Raucous sci-fi action sequel with Shia LaBeouf and Megan Fox. Can Sam and Mikaela prevent the scourge of the Decepticon robots from destroying the Earth?

programme.title: Last Night in Soho Interview...
programme.desc: ...Special: Director Edgar Wright and co-writer Krysty Wilson-Cairns discuss travelling through time and recreating the past to make the ingenious and atmospheric psychological thriller.

programme.title: Where the Crawdads Sing
programme.desc: (2022) Daisy Edgar-Jones stars in director Olivia Newman's adaptation of Delia Owens' best-selling novel about a feral child who's accused of murder in America's Deep South. Did she do it?

programme.title: The Night House
programme.desc: (2020) Supernatural horror with Rebecca Hall. A woman starts to think her dead husband is haunting her as she wrestles with her grief in the isolated lakeside house he built for them.

programme.title: Pig
programme.desc: (2021) Thriller. Nicolas Cage delivers a subtle turn in Michael Sarnoski's debut, an intriguing tale of an off-the-grid truffle hunter who returns to the city to rescue his kidnapped pig.

programme.desc: (1954) Western starring Dana Andrews. A man falsely accused of murder gets a last-minute reprieve from the lynch mob so he can track down the real culprit.

programme.title: Hell Is a City
programme.desc: (1960) Classic crime thriller with Stanley Baker and Billie Whitelaw. A world-weary detective with a messy private life tracks a violent thief through the streets of Manchester.

programme.title: The Man Between
programme.desc: (1953) Atmospheric thriller set in post-war Berlin, where Ivo Kern (James Mason) and Susanne Mallison (Claire Bloom) get caught up in a maelstrom of bigamy, blackmail and bullets.

programme.title: Siege at Red River
programme.desc: (1954) Western. Van Johnson stars as a Confederate agent who steals a Gatling gun prototype from the Yankees and attempts to smuggle it south through enemy lines to his own side.

programme.title: G.I. Joe: The Rise of Cobra
programme.desc: (2009) Action adventure with Channing Tatum, Sienna Miller and Christopher Eccleston. Terrorists steal a devastating weapon and only the USA's finest - the GI Joes - can stop them.

programme.title: M3GAN
programme.desc: (2022) Creepy-doll horror with Allison Williams. A robotics engineer simultaneously invents an AI dolly and takes on the care of her orphaned niece. But can a cyborg really raise a kid?

programme.title: Bullet Train
programme.desc: (2022) Leaving from Platform 4 - a high octane, Shinkansen-set comedy thriller with Brad Pitt, Joey King and Michael Shannon. A jaded assassin does one last job on a villain-packed train.

programme.title: Barbarian
programme.desc: (2022) Don't-go-down-in-the-cellar horror with Georgina Campbell. A double-booked Airbnb leads a woman into some very dark places beneath the house she's staying in. With Bill SkarsgÃ¥rd.

programme.title: Robin and Marian
programme.desc: (1976) Touching romance starring Sean Connery and Audrey Hepburn. The ageing legend Robin Hood returns to Sherwood Forest and discovers that, while he was away, Marian has become an Abbess.

programme.title: The Sound Barrier
programme.desc: (1952) Drama starring Ralph Richardson as a pioneering aviator determined to break the sound barrier, even if it means risking the lives of those closest to him. Directed by David Lean.

programme.title: Carrington, VC
programme.desc: (1954) Anthony Asquith's vivid and subtle courtroom drama casts David Niven as the eponymous officer accused of stealing army money and going absent without leave.

programme.title: Where the Crawdads Sing
programme.desc: (2022) Daisy Edgar-Jones stars in director Olivia Newman's adaptation of Delia Owens' best-selling novel about a feral child who's accused of murder in America's Deep South. Did she do it?

programme.title: The Night House
programme.desc: (2020) Supernatural horror with Rebecca Hall. A woman starts to think her dead husband is haunting her as she wrestles with her grief in the isolated lakeside house he built for them.

programme.title: Pig
programme.desc: (2021) Thriller. Nicolas Cage delivers a subtle turn in Michael Sarnoski's debut, an intriguing tale of an off-the-grid truffle hunter who returns to the city to rescue his kidnapped pig.

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: (1954) Crime-comedy starring Alec Guinness. A priest is tasked with accompanying a priceless religious artifact from London to Rome. But the prolific thief Flambeau is hot on his trail...

programme.title: Three Hours to Kill
programme.desc: (1954) Western starring Dana Andrews. A man falsely accused of murder gets a last-minute reprieve from the lynch mob so he can track down the real culprit.

programme.title: Mandy
programme.desc: (1952) Poignant Ealing drama starring seven-year-old Mandy Miller as a deaf girl whose parents - played by Phyllis Calvert and Terence Morgan - fight over her treatment.

programme.title: Nicholas Nickleby
programme.desc: (1947) Drama with Derek Bond, based on Charles Dickens' novel. After his father dies, Nicholas seeks the help of his cold, avaricious, scheming uncle. Predictably, it doesn't go well.

programme.title: First Knight
programme.desc: (1995) Romantic drama based on Arthurian legend, starring Richard Gere, Sean Connery and Julia Ormond. Can nomadic swordsman Lancelot contain his love for King Arthur's fiancÃ©e?

programme.title: Late Night with the Devil
programme.desc: (2023) Unsettling found-footage horror with David Dastmalchian. A has-been host tries to save his 70s talk show using a demonically possessed 13-year-old girl. Really, what could go wrong?

programme.title: Angel Has Fallen
programme.desc: (2019) Action-thriller sequel. Secret agent Mike Banning (Gerard Butler) goes on the run when he's framed for an attack on the President. Can he clear his name?
